author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request met all of the guidelines for auto-merging and is scheduled to be merged when the mandatory waiting period has elapsed.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have read the package naming guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

This is a fork of EzXML.jl which got a commit only a month ago from the author. This fork is also broken in the sense that the docs, CI etc doesn't work. 

The fact that the name is almost the same means there is a risk of confusion between the two packages. In fact there has been talk about prohibiting this type of naming because it can be a security risk.

The only reason for this seems to be that the show method is broken (on 1.4?) which seems excessive to register a fork as a workaround for.

> 
> 
> This is a fork of EzXML.jl which got a commit only a month ago from the author. This fork is also broken in the sense that the docs, CI etc doesn't work.
> 
> The fact that the name is almost the same means there is a risk of confusion between the two packages. In fact there has been talk about prohibiting this type of naming because it can be a security risk.
> 
> The only reason for this seems to be that the show method is broken (on 1.4?) which seems excessive to register a fork as a workaround for.


I am more than happy to get the original package working again. 

The problem with personal repositories that are not in any organization is this. I totally understand that @bicycle1885 may not want to maintain the package anymore, and that's why I am registering a new one.

Please close this in favour of https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/pull/10325
